recipes.title: Savory Chickpea Pancakes
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped fresh herbs (parsley, cilantro, etc.)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the chickpea flour, water, salt, turmeric, and cumin until smooth.
Stir in the fresh herbs.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour the batter into the pan to form small pancakes, about 4-5 inches in diameter.
Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Top with chopped tomatoes and avocado before serving.
recipes.notes: These pancakes are high in protein and gluten-free.

recipes.title: Black Rice & Edamame Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cooked black rice, edamame, cucumber, and shredded carrots.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and grated ginger.
Pour the dressing over the rice mixture and toss to combine.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.
recipes.notes: This salad is high in protein and fiber, making it a filling and nutritious option.

recipes.title: Turmeric and Lentil Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the turmeric and cumin, and cook for another minute.
Add the red lentils, diced carrot, bay leaf, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until the lentils are tender.
Remove the bay leaf, season with salt and pepper, and stir in the lime juice before serving.
recipes.notes: This soup is rich in protein and fiber, with anti-inflammatory benefits from turmeric.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, remove the seeds, and place cut-side down on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30-40 minutes, until tender.
Once cool enough to handle, use a fork to scrape the flesh into spaghetti-like strands.
In a large pan, heat the coconut oil over medium heat and sauté the tofu until golden brown.
Add the red bell pepper, carrot, and garlic, and cook for another 5 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, peanut butter, lime juice, and honey or maple syrup.
Add the spaghetti squash strands to the pan, pour the sauce over, and toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped peanuts and green onions before serving.
recipes.notes: This dish is a low-carb, high-protein alternative to traditional Pad Thai.

recipes.title: Roasted Romanesco with Tahini Sauce
ingredients: 1 head of Romanesco, cut into florets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the Romanesco florets with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and spread them out on a baking sheet.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.
In a small bowl, whisk together the tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and water until smooth.
Drizzle the tahini sauce over the roasted Romanesco before serving.
recipes.notes: Romanesco is a nutritious cruciferous vegetable, high in vitamins C and K.

recipes.title: Quinoa Energy Balls
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the cooked quinoa, almond butter, honey or maple syrup, dark chocolate chips, chia seeds, vanilla extract, and salt.
Roll the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
recipes.notes: These energy balls are high in protein and perfect for a quick, healthy snack.

recipes.title: Avocado Chocolate Mousse
instructions: In a food processor, combine the avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, almond milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Transfer to small bowls or ramekins and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
recipes.notes: This mousse is rich and creamy, yet free from dairy and refined sugar.

recipes.title: Spirulina Green Smoothie
instructions: In a blender, combine the banana, spinach, spirulina powder, almond butter, almond milk, and chia seeds.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.
recipes.notes: Spirulina is a nutrient-dense superfood, rich in protein and antioxidants.

recipes.title: Almond Flour Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine the mashed bananas, eggs, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the almond flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into a greased or lined loaf pan.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow to cool before slicing.
recipes.notes: This banana bread is gluten-free and lower in carbohydrates than traditional recipes.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Tofu with Spicy Peanut Sauce
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Toss the tofu cubes with 2 tbsp soy sauce and olive oil.
Spread the tofu on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden and crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, sriracha, soy sauce, lime juice, honey or maple syrup, garlic, and water until smooth.
Drizzle the sauce over the baked tofu before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This dish is high in protein and pairs well with steamed vegetables or brown rice.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Beet and Quinoa Salad
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wrap the beets in foil and roast for 45-60 minutes, until tender.
Once cool, peel and dice the beets.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, diced beets, feta, walnuts, and arugula or greens.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: This salad is rich in antioxidants and perfect for a light yet filling meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the diced sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, smoked paprika, and chili powder.
Spread the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a small pot, warm the black beans over low heat.
Assemble the tacos by placing roasted sweet potatoes and black beans on each tortilla.
Top with sliced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: These tacos are vegan, gluten-free, and packed with fiber and plant-based protein.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 medium head of cauliflower, grated or riced
instructions: Heat the sesame oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the garlic and ginger, and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the grated cauliflower, diced carrot, and peas, and cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and pour the beaten eggs into the empty space.
Scramble the eggs until cooked through, then mix with the vegetables.
Stir in the soy sauce and chopped green onion before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This dish is a low-carb alternative to traditional fried rice, with plenty of veggies.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Turkey
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large pan, sauté the chopped onion and garlic until softened.
Add the ground turkey, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper, and cook until the turkey is browned.
Stir in the cooked quinoa and tomato sauce.
Stuff each bell pepper with the turkey-quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Top with shredded cheese if using.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes until the peppers are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed peppers are high in protein and make a complete meal on their own.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto and Grilled Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, grilled and sliced
instructions: Grill the chicken breast over medium heat for 6-7 minutes on each side, or until fully cooked. Slice and set aside.
In a large pan, lightly sauté the spiralized zucchini noodles for 2-3 minutes until just tender.
Toss the zucchini noodles with pesto sauce, cherry tomatoes, and sliced grilled chicken.
Season with salt and pepper, and top with toasted pine nuts and grated Parmesan cheese if desired before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: Zucchini noodles are a great low-carb pasta alternative, and the dish is high in protein.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Curry Lentils
instructions: In a large pot, heat the coconut oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in the curry powder and turmeric, and cook for another minute.
Add the lentils, diced carrot, coconut milk, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until the lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This dish is creamy, rich in flavor, and packed with plant-based protein.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt Parfait with Berries and Nuts
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer half of the Greek yogurt at the bottom.
Add half of the mixed berries on top of the yogurt.
Add the remaining yogurt, followed by the remaining berries.
Sprinkle with granola and chopped nuts.
Drizzle with honey or maple syrup before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This parfait is high in protein and makes for a quick, nutritious breakfast or snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Edamame and Avocado Dip
instructions: In a food processor, blend the edamame, avocado, garlic, lime juice, cilantro, and olive oil until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with vegetable sticks, pita chips, or as a spread for sandwiches.
nutritional_facts.notes: This dip is rich in healthy fats and plant-based protein.

nutritional_facts.title: Almond Butter Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond milk, almond butter, chia seeds, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well to combine.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, top with fresh fruit if desired before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This make-ahead breakfast is convenient and high in fiber and healthy fats.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea and Spinach Stew
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Stir in the cumin and smoked paprika, cooking for 1 minute.
Add the chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This stew is high in fiber and protein, making it a hearty and nutritious meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango and Black Bean Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, mango, bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
nutritional_facts.notes: This salad is vibrant and full of flavor, perfect for a refreshing and filling meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms with Goat Cheese
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, mix the goat cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, basil, and garlic.
Brush the mushrooms with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff each mushroom with the goat cheese mixture.
Place the mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender.
Serve warm.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed mushrooms are rich and flavorful, perfect as an appetizer or side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Carrot and Ginger Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, sauté until softened.
Stir in the chopped carrots and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the carrots are tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This soup is warming and full of antioxidants, perfect for a healthy lunch or dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Cucumber Sushi Rolls
instructions: In a small bowl, mix the rice vinegar and sugar into the cooked sushi rice.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
Place a few slices of avocado and cucumber along the bottom edge of the rice.
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat, then slice into bite-sized pieces.
Serve with soy sauce for dipping.
nutritional_facts.notes: These sushi rolls are vegan and refreshing, perfect for a light snack or appetizer.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Chia Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the chia seeds, coconut milk, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well and let sit for 5 minutes, then stir again to prevent clumping.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Serve chilled, topped with fresh fruit if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: This chia pudding is creamy, rich in omega-3s, and makes for a healthy dessert or breakfast.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Glazed Brussels Sprouts
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss the halved Brussels sprouts with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
Spread the Brussels sprouts on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until the sprouts are caramelized and tender.
Serve warm as a side dish.
nutritional_facts.notes: These Brussels sprouts are sweet, tangy, and perfectly roasted for a delicious side.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Lentil Curry
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced
instructions: In a large pot, heat the coconut oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Stir in the curry powder and cumin, cooking for 1 minute.
Add the diced sweet potato, lentils, coconut milk, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes until the sweet potatoes and lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This curry is hearty, flavorful, and packed with plant-based protein and fiber.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Chicken Souvlaki Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into cubes
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken cubes and toss to coat. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Thread the chicken onto the soaked skewers.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve with pita bread and tzatziki sauce if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: These skewers are high in protein and perfect for a light and flavorful main dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Beet and Orange Salad
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wrap the beets in foil and roast for 45-60 minutes, until tender. Let cool, then slice.
In a large bowl, toss the mixed greens with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Top the greens with roasted beet slices, orange segments, crumbled feta, and toasted walnuts.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: This salad is vibrant, refreshing, and full of flavor, perfect for a healthy lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish.
Top with shredded cheese if using.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until peppers are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and nutritious meal that is high in protein and fiber.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, chili powder, paprika, and garlic powder.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until tender.
Warm tortillas in a skillet or oven.
Fill tortillas with roasted sweet potatoes and black beans.
Top with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice.
nutritional_facts.notes: These tacos are vibrant, hearty, and packed with nutrients.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea and Spinach Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté the red onion and garlic until softened.
Add the chickpeas and spinach, and cook until spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon the mixture into mushroom caps and place on a baking sheet.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if using.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until mushrooms are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed mushrooms are a great protein-packed appetizer or snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, etc.)
Cooked brown rice or noodles for serving
instructions: In a large skillet or wok, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, and sauté for 1 minute.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Stir in cooked lentils, soy sauce, and hoisin sauce.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until everything is heated through.
Serve over brown rice or noodles.
nutritional_facts.notes: This stir-fry is quick, easy, and packed with protein and veggies.

nutritional_facts.title: Butternut Squash and Sage Risotto
ingredients: 2 cups butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss butternut squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast for 25-30 minutes until tender.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté the onion and garlic until translucent.
Add Arborio rice and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add white wine if using, and cook until mostly absorbed.
Gradually add vegetable broth, one ladle at a time, stirring frequently, until rice is creamy and cooked through.
Stir in roasted butternut squash, Parmesan cheese, and fresh sage.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This creamy risotto is rich in flavor and makes for a comforting meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix together spinach, feta cheese, and garlic.
Cut a pocket into each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach mixture.
Secure with toothpicks if necessary.
Season the chicken with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and sear the chicken for 2-3 minutes per side.
Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, until cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: This dish is packed with flavor and makes a great high-protein meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and sauté for 3-4 minutes until tender.
Stir in basil pesto and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Top with grated Parmesan cheese and cherry tomatoes if using.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to pasta that's full of fresh flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Cauliflower with Tahini Sauce
ingredients: 1 large head of cauliflower, cut into florets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss cauliflower florets with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and tender.
In a small bowl, mix tahini, lemon juice, water, and minced garlic to make the sauce.
Drizzle the tahini sauce over the roasted cauliflower before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A delicious side dish that's both creamy and crunchy.

nutritional_facts.title: Kale and White Bean Soup
ingredients: 1 bunch kale, stems removed and chopped
1 can white beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and carrot, and sauté until softened.
Stir in vegetable broth, white beans, and thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add kale and cook for an additional 5 minutes, until kale is tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and nutritious soup that’s perfect for a chilly day.

nutritional_facts.title: Cabbage and Apple Slaw
instructions: In a large bowl, combine shredded cabbage, apple, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together apple cider vinegar, honey, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat.
Let sit for at least 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
nutritional_facts.notes: A crisp and refreshing slaw that pairs well with any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Salmon with Dill and Lemon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Top with fresh dill and lemon slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until salmon is cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and elegant dish that’s rich in omega-3 fatty acids.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Tomato Gazpacho
instructions: In a blender, combine avocados, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and garlic.
Blend until smooth, then add olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Blend again until well combined.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A cool and creamy soup that's perfect for hot days.

nutritional_facts.title: Turkey and Spinach Meatballs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, mix together ground turkey, spinach, bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, egg, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Form mixture into meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: These meatballs are a lean and nutritious option for a main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Cucumber and Avocado Sushi Rolls
instructions: In a small bowl, mix rice vinegar and sugar into the cooked sushi rice.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat.
Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
Place cucumber and avocado slices along the bottom edge.
Roll tightly using the bamboo mat.
Slice into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: Fresh and light sushi rolls that are easy to make at home.

nutritional_facts.title: Eggplant and Chickpea Curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add eggplant, chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and coconut milk.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, until eggplant is tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty curry that's rich in protein and flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt and Berry Parfait
instructions: In serving glasses or bowls, layer Greek yogurt, mixed berries, and granola.
Drizzle with honey on top.
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and healthy dessert that's high in protein and antioxidants.

nutritional_facts.title: Almond-Crusted Tilapia
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush tilapia fillets with Dijon mustard and dip in beaten egg.
Coat with almond meal, pressing to adhere.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, until fish flakes easily.
nutritional_facts.notes: A crunchy and nutty crust that adds a delicious twist to tilapia.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Carrot and Chickpea Salad
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss carrots and chickpeas with olive oil, cumin, and paprika.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until carrots are tender.
In a large bowl, toss mixed greens with balsamic vinaigrette.
Top with roasted carrots, chickpeas, and crumbled feta.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty salad that's perfect as a main dish or side.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-sized pieces
1 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, bell peppers)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and mixed vegetables, and stir-fry until tender.
Push vegetables to one side and pour beaten eggs into the pan.
Scramble eggs and mix with vegetables.
Add cauliflower rice and soy sauce, and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
Garnish with green onions before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional fried rice that’s still satisfying.

nutritional_facts.title: Black Bean and Sweet Potato Chili
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in chili powder and cumin, and cook for 1 minute.
Add sweet potato, black beans, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Simmer for 25-30 minutes, until sweet potato is tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and filling chili that's perfect for a comforting meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Pear and Walnut Salad with Blue Cheese
instructions: In a large bowl, toss mixed greens with balsamic vinaigrette.
Top with pear slices, toasted walnuts, and crumbled blue cheese.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A sweet and savory salad that's perfect for a light lunch or dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Marinara Sauce
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place cut side down on a baking sheet and roast for 40-45 minutes, until tender.
Scrape the flesh with a fork to create spaghetti-like strands.
Top with marinara sauce, grated Parmesan, and fresh basil.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb pasta alternative that's satisfying and delicious.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove seeds.
In a bowl, mix quinoa, black beans, corn, tomatoes, cheese, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the bell peppers.
Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes, until peppers are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and nutritious meal that's easy to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Spicy Lentil Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, carrot, and celery, and sauté until softened.
Stir in chili powder and cumin, and cook for 1 minute.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and warming soup with a spicy kick.

nutritional_facts.title: Chia Seed Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, combine chia seeds, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Mix well and let sit for 5 minutes.
Stir again to prevent clumping.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Top with fresh fruit before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and nutritious dessert that's perfect for meal prep.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini and Sweet Corn Fritters
instructions: Place grated zucchini in a clean towel and squeeze out excess moisture.
In a bowl, combine zucchini, corn, flour, Parmesan cheese, eggs, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the skillet and flatten with a spatula.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
nutritional_facts.notes: Crispy and delicious fritters that make a great snack or appetizer.

nutritional_facts.title: Butternut Squash and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 1 small butternut squash, peeled and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss butternut squash with olive oil, chili powder, and cumin.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet or oven.
Fill each tortilla with roasted squash, black beans, red onion, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.
nutritional_facts.notes: Flavorful and satisfying tacos that are easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa and Chickpea Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and refreshing salad that's perfect for lunch or a side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Pesto
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place cut side down on a baking sheet and roast for 40-45 minutes, until tender.
Scrape the flesh with a fork to create spaghetti-like strands.
Toss with basil pesto and top with grated Parmesan cheese before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and flavorful pasta alternative that's low in carbs.

nutritional_facts.title: Cucumber and Hummus Sandwiches
instructions: Spread hummus on one side of each bread slice.
Top with cucumber slices and garnish with fresh dill.
Place another slice of bread on top to make a sandwich.
Cut into triangles and serve.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and refreshing sandwich that's perfect for a snack or light lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Dill
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Top with lemon slices, dill, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and elegant dish that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Burritos
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large bowl, mix roasted sweet potato, black beans, and cheese.
Divide mixture among tortillas and roll up.
Heat in a skillet over medium heat, or bake for 10 minutes until warmed through.
nutritional_facts.notes: Satisfying and healthy burritos that are easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Tuna Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine tuna, avocado, red onion, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
Gently toss to combine and serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and nutritious salad that's quick to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Garlic
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until crispy and tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and tasty side dish that's easy to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Turkey and Spinach Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil and cook ground turkey until browned.
Add garlic and spinach, and cook until spinach is wilted.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff mushroom caps with the turkey mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A savory and protein-packed appetizer that's perfect for parties.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Kale Hash
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and bell pepper, and cook until softened.
Add sweet potatoes and paprika, and cook for 10-15 minutes, until potatoes are tender.
Stir in kale and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A nutritious and filling hash that's great for breakfast or lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango and Black Bean Salsa
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a bowl, combine mango, black beans, red bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and season with salt.
Toss to combine and serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos.
nutritional_facts.notes: A sweet and savory salsa that's perfect for dipping or adding to dishes.

nutritional_facts.title: Chicken and Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 minute.
Add vegetables and cook until tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce and hoisin sauce.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until everything is well-coated and heated through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and healthy stir-fry that can be served over rice or noodles.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt and Berry Parfait
instructions: In serving glasses, layer Greek yogurt, mixed berries, and granola.
Drizzle with honey on top.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and nutritious dessert that's perfect for breakfast or a snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Eggplant and Tomato Gratin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Arrange eggplant slices on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Roast for 15 minutes, until slightly tender.
In a baking dish, layer eggplant slices with diced tomatoes.
Top with mozzarella and Parmesan cheese, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and cheesy side dish that's perfect with any main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Curried Cauliflower Rice
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-like texture
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and cook until translucent.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add cauliflower rice and peas, and cook for 5-7 minutes, until tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional rice, full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 minute.
Add broccoli and cook until tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce and hoisin sauce.
Cook for an additional 2 minutes, until everything is well-coated.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving, if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic stir-fry that's packed with flavor and protein.

nutritional_facts.title: Pumpkin and Sage Risotto
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until translucent.
Stir in Arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes.
Add vegetable broth 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly, until rice is creamy and tender.
Stir in pumpkin puree, Parmesan cheese, sage, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting risotto with the flavors of fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Chickpea Buddha Bowl
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast for 25-30 minutes until tender.
In a bowl, mix tahini with lemon juice and a little water to make a dressing.
In serving bowls, arrange quinoa, roasted sweet potato, chickpeas, baby spinach, and avocado slices.
Drizzle with tahini dressing before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A nutrient-dense bowl that's full of flavor and texture.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Arrange on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, turning halfway through.
Spread marinara sauce on each slice, and top with mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and dried basil.
Return to oven and bake for an additional 15 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
nutritional_facts.notes: A lighter version of the classic eggplant Parmesan, baked instead of fried.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops removed and seeds scooped out
1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix quinoa, black beans, corn, tomatoes, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the bell peppers with the quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Drizzle with olive oil and top with shredded cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and healthy dish that's packed with protein and fiber.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Spinach Curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and cook until softened.
Stir in curry powder and turmeric, and cook for 1 minute.
Add lentils, coconut milk, and 2 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warming and hearty curry that's perfect for a weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Falafel with Tzatziki Sauce
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, parsley, garlic, onion, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper.
Pulse until a coarse mixture forms.
Form the mixture into small patties and place them on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
For the tzatziki sauce, mix Greek yogurt, cucumber, lemon juice, and dill in a bowl.
Serve the falafel with the tzatziki sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and delicious appetizer that's great for parties.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Portobello Mushrooms with Balsamic Glaze
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Brush the mushrooms with the marinade and let them sit for 10 minutes.
Preheat a grill to medium heat.
Grill the mushrooms for 5-7 minutes on each side, until tender.
Serve with additional balsamic glaze drizzled on top.
nutritional_facts.notes: A savory and satisfying plant-based dish that's perfect for grilling season.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Marinara Sauce
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds.
Brush the inside with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes, until tender.
Use a fork to scrape the flesh into spaghetti-like strands.
Heat the marinara sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
Serve the spaghetti squash topped with marinara sauce and grated Parmesan cheese.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to pasta that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower and Chickpea Tacos
ingredients: 1 small head cauliflower, cut into florets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss cauliflower florets and chickpeas with olive oil, cumin, paprika, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the mixture on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until the cauliflower is tender and browned.
Warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or in the oven.
Fill each tortilla with the roasted cauliflower and chickpea mixture.
Top with cilantro, red onion, and a squeeze of lime juice.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and flavorful vegetarian taco option.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Pineapple Chicken Skewers
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, olive oil, garlic, and ginger.
Add the chicken cubes to the marinade and let them sit for 20 minutes.
Thread the chicken and pineapple chunks onto skewers.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving, if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A sweet and savory grilled dish that's perfect for summer.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breasts
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut a pocket into each chicken breast.
In a bowl, mix spinach, feta cheese, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into each chicken breast and secure with toothpicks.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Sear the chicken breasts for 2-3 minutes on each side, until browned.
Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, until cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and protein-rich chicken dish that's easy to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the butternut squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast the squash on a baking sheet for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large pot, sauté the onion and garlic until softened.
Add the roasted squash, vegetable broth, and nutmeg.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in the coconut milk and adjust seasoning as needed.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting soup that's perfect for fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes, until slightly softened.
Stir in the pesto and cherry tomatoes.
Cook for another 2 minutes, until heated through.
Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and fresh dish that's perfect for summer.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Acorn Squash with Wild Rice
ingredients: 2 acorn squashes, halved and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush the cut sides of the acorn squash with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes, until tender.
In a bowl, mix wild rice, cranberries, walnuts, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Fill the roasted squash halves with the rice mixture.
Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until heated through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and filling dish that's perfect for a fall dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Herb Grilled Salmon
instructions: In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, dill, parsley, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes on each side, until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and flavorful way to enjoy salmon.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato Black Bean Chili
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, and smoked paprika, and cook for 1 minute.
Add sweet potato, black beans, and diced tomatoes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the sweet potato is tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and filling chili that's perfect for cold weather.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Crusted Tofu with Mango Salsa
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cut into cubes
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix shredded coconut, panko breadcrumbs, and a pinch of salt.
Dip tofu cubes in flour, then coconut milk, and then coat with the coconut mixture.
Place the tofu cubes on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until golden and crispy.
In a separate bowl, mix mango, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Serve the coconut-crusted tofu with mango salsa on top.
nutritional_facts.notes: A tropical and crunchy tofu dish that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Fritters with Yogurt Sauce
instructions: Place grated zucchini in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze out excess moisture.
In a bowl, mix zucchini, flour, Parmesan, egg, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Drop spoonfuls of the zucchini mixture into the skillet and flatten into fritters.
Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
For the yogurt sauce, mix Greek yogurt, lemon juice, and dill in a bowl.
Serve the fritters with the yogurt sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: A crispy and delicious appetizer that's perfect for summer.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Pizza Crust
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Microwave the grated cauliflower for 5 minutes, then squeeze out excess moisture with a clean towel.
In a bowl, mix cauliflower, Parmesan, mozzarella, egg, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the mixture onto a parchment-lined baking sheet, forming a pizza crust shape.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until golden and firm.
Add your desired toppings and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional pizza crust that's surprisingly delicious.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Vegetable Quinoa Salad
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
Preheat a grill to medium heat.
Toss bell pepper, zucchini, and yellow squash slices with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill the vegetables for 3-4 minutes on each side, until tender and slightly charred.
In a large bowl, mix quinoa, grilled vegetables, cherry tomatoes, and feta cheese.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and nutritious salad that's perfect for summer.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Baked Chicken Wings
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss chicken wings with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Arrange the wings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the wings are crispy and golden.
In a small bowl, mix hot sauce with a little extra olive oil.
Toss the wings in the hot sauce mixture just before serving.
Garnish with chopped parsley.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier alternative to fried wings that's just as delicious.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
instructions: Spread mashed avocado on the toasted bread slices.
Bring a pot of water to a simmer and add vinegar.
Crack each egg into a small bowl and gently slide it into the water.
Poach the eggs for 3-4 minutes, until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Use a slotted spoon to remove the eggs from the water and place them on the avocado toast.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and nutritious breakfast option that's quick to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Beet Salad with Goat Cheese
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the beets with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast the beets on a baking sheet for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large bowl, toss the mixed greens with balsamic vinegar and a pinch of salt.
Top with roasted beets, goat cheese, and walnuts before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A vibrant and flavorful salad that's perfect for any season.

nutritional_facts.title: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
instructions: In a blender, combine avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, almond milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Spoon the mousse into serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A rich and creamy dessert that's surprisingly healthy.

nutritional_facts.title: Creamy Garlic Mashed Cauliflower
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add chopped cauliflower and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain the cauliflower and return it to the pot.
Add garlic, Parmesan cheese, Greek yogurt, and butter.
Use an immersion blender to mash the cauliflower until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to mashed potatoes that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Honey Soy Glazed Pork Chops
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and olive oil.
Season the pork chops with salt and pepper.
Marinate the pork chops in the soy-honey mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the pork chops for 4-5 minutes on each side, basting with the marinade, until fully cooked.
Let the pork chops rest for a few minutes before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and flavorful dish that's perfect for a weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Caprese Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush the mushrooms with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place the mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and fill each mushroom with cherry tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and savory appetizer that's perfect for entertaining.

nutritional_facts.title: Pumpkin Spice Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine oats, almond milk, pumpkin puree, maple syrup, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon, and vanilla extract.
Stir well and cover.
Refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, give it a good stir and top with chopped pecans before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A cozy and nutritious breakfast that tastes like fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic Butter Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until pink and opaque.
Stir in white wine, lemon juice, and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over cooked pasta.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and easy shrimp dish with a rich, garlicky sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Marinara Sauce
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds.
Brush the inside with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 40 minutes, until tender.
Use a fork to scrape the flesh into strands.
Heat marinara sauce in a saucepan and pour over the spaghetti squash.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and garnish with fresh basil.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and low-carb alternative to pasta.

nutritional_facts.title: Cilantro Lime Rice
instructions: In a saucepan, bring water to a boil.
Add rice and a pinch of salt.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes, until rice is tender.
Fluff the rice with a fork and stir in lime juice, lime zest, cilantro, and olive oil.
Season with additional salt if needed.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and zesty side dish that pairs well with Mexican cuisine.

nutritional_facts.title: Chicken Fajita Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, halved and seeded
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and bell peppers, and sauté until softened.
Stir in the shredded chicken and fajita seasoning.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper half with the chicken mixture.
Top with shredded cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and healthy twist on classic fajitas.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango Coconut Chia Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together chia seeds, coconut milk, and maple syrup.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Stir well before serving and top with diced mango and shredded coconut.
nutritional_facts.notes: A tropical and refreshing dessert that's rich in healthy fats.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the butternut squash cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast on a baking sheet for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large pot, sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
Add the roasted squash and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in coconut milk and nutmeg.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting soup that's perfect for fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Roasted Brussels Sprouts
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper.
Toss the Brussels sprouts in the balsamic mixture until well coated.
Spread the sprouts on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until caramelized and tender.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: A sweet and tangy side dish that's a crowd-pleaser.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Acorn Squash
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush the acorn squash halves with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and cinnamon.
Place the squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 40 minutes, until tender.
Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, cranberries, pecans, and feta cheese.
Stuff the roasted squash halves with the quinoa mixture.
Return to the oven for an additional 10 minutes before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and flavorful vegetarian main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Roasted Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff the lemon halves into the cavity of the chicken.
In a small bowl, mix garlic, olive oil, and thyme.
Rub the garlic mixture all over the chicken.
Place the chicken on a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic roasted chicken with a bright and zesty flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1/2 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil, sprinkle with shredded cheese, and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and filling vegetarian dish that's easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season the eggplant slices with salt and let them sit for 10 minutes to draw out moisture. Pat dry.
Dredge each eggplant slice in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with panko breadcrumbs.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Fry the eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides.
In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, fried eggplant, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese.
Repeat layers, ending with cheese on top.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic Italian dish that's perfect for a comforting dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Tzatziki Sauce
instructions: In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt, grated cucumber, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and dill.
Mix well and season with salt and pepper.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and creamy sauce that's perfect for dipping or as a spread.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato Black Bean Chili
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, sauté the onion and garlic until softened.
Add sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in black beans, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, chili powder, cumin, and smoked paprika.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and healthy chili that's perfect for a cold day.

nutritional_facts.title: Teriyaki Salmon
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic.
Place the salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them.
Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes, until cooked through.
Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and easy-to-make salmon dish with a sweet and savory glaze.

nutritional_facts.title: Blueberry Almond Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar or bowl, combine oats, almond milk, blueberries, almond butter, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well and cover.
Refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, stir and top with chopped almonds before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A protein-packed breakfast that's perfect for busy mornings.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-sized pieces
instructions: In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add the grated cauliflower and cook for 5 minutes.
Push the cauliflower to the side and pour in the beaten eggs.
Scramble the eggs until fully cooked, then mix them with the cauliflower.
Stir in the frozen peas and carrots, soy sauce, and green onions.
Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional fried rice.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic Herb Roasted Potatoes
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, toss the potatoes with olive oil, garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Spread the potatoes on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and crispy.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and flavorful side dish that's perfect for any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, poppy seeds, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, mix melted butter, milk, lemon juice, lemon zest, and egg.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Spoon the batter into the muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A zesty and light muffin that's perfect for breakfast or dessert.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine romaine lettuce, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and Kalamata olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Sprinkle with crumbled feta cheese before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and flavorful salad that's perfect as a side or a light meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
instructions: In a blender, combine avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, almond milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Divide the mousse into serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A rich and creamy dessert that's surprisingly healthy.

nutritional_facts.title: BBQ Pulled Jackfruit Sandwich
ingredients: 2 cans young green jackfruit, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add sliced onion and cook until softened.
Add the drained jackfruit, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Cook for 5 minutes, breaking up the jackfruit with a fork to resemble pulled pork.
Stir in BBQ sauce and cook for another 10 minutes, until the jackfruit is tender and well-coated.
Serve the BBQ pulled jackfruit on hamburger buns with coleslaw, if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A plant-based alternative to pulled pork that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from heat and mix in the feta cheese.
Cut a pocket into each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach and feta mixture.
Secure with toothpicks if necessary, and season with salt and pepper.
Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, until fully cooked.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and flavorful chicken dish perfect for a weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, cherry tomatoes, corn, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A protein-packed salad that's perfect for lunch or a light dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add butternut squash, vegetable broth, nutmeg, and cinnamon.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the squash is tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in coconut milk and season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting soup that's perfect for fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Caprese Skewers
instructions: Thread cherry tomatoes, mozzarella cubes, and basil leaves onto skewers.
Arrange the skewers on a platter and drizzle with balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and elegant appetizer that's perfect for parties.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned.
Stir in cooked rice, diced tomatoes, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the bell peppers with the turkey mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil, sprinkle with shredded cheese, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and colorful dish that's perfect for dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Pumpkin Spice Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and salt.
In another bowl, mix pumpkin puree, milk, and egg.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and melt a small amount of butter.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet and cook until bubbles form on the surface.
Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Repeat with remaining batter.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warm and cozy breakfast that's perfect for fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Baked Tofu
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, toss the tofu cubes with soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread the tofu on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through, until crispy and golden.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce or as part of a stir-fry.
nutritional_facts.notes: A versatile and protein-packed dish that's great for vegetarians.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions and drain.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Toss the cooked spaghetti with the shrimp mixture until well combined.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and zesty pasta dish that's quick and easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the sweet potato cubes with olive oil, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
Warm the corn tortillas in a dry skillet or in the oven.
Fill the tortillas with roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, cilantro, and queso fresco, if using.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and vegetarian-friendly taco recipe that's full of nutrients.

nutritional_facts.title: Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, mix mashed bananas, melted butter, sugar, egg, and vanilla extract.
Stir in baking soda and salt.
Add flour and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan and bake for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool before slicing.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic and comforting dessert that's perfect for using up ripe bananas.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
instructions: Mash the avocados in a bowl and season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice, if desired.
Spread the mashed avocado on the toasted bread.
To poach the eggs, bring a pot of water to a simmer and add the white vinegar.
Crack the eggs into the simmering water and cook for 3-4 minutes, until the whites are set.
Remove the eggs with a slotted spoon and place one on each slice of avocado toast.
Sprinkle with red pepper flakes before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and healthy breakfast that's packed with protein and healthy fats.

nutritional_facts.title: Teriyaki Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, sliced into strips
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add chicken strips and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add broccoli, bell pepper, and carrot to the skillet and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour in the teriyaki sauce and toss to coat everything evenly.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and easy dinner option that's full of flavor and nutrients.

nutritional_facts.title: Ratatouille
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Add eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, and red bell pepper.
Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, thyme, basil, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the flavors are well combined.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic French vegetable dish that's healthy and bursting with flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, whisk together oats, flour, baking soda, and cinnamon.
In another bowl, cream together butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown.
nutritional_facts.notes: A chewy and delicious cookie recipe that's perfect for any occasion.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Brussels Sprouts
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spread them on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and crispy.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and tasty side dish that's perfect for any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt Parfait
instructions: In a glass or bowl, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and fresh berries.
Drizzle with honey before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and healthy breakfast that's perfect for busy mornings.

nutritional_facts.title: Classic Hummus
instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Blend until smooth, adding a little water if needed to reach desired consistency.
Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with paprika.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic and versatile dip that's great with pita bread or vegetables.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Baked Chicken Wings
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken wings, split and tips removed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, toss the chicken wings with baking powder, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
Arrange the wings on a wire rack set over a baking sheet.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, turning halfway through, until crispy and golden brown.
nutritional_facts.notes: Crispy wings without the need for frying.

nutritional_facts.title: Smashed Potatoes
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain and place the potatoes on a baking sheet.
Using a fork or potato masher, gently smash each potato.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until crispy.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A crispy and flavorful potato side dish that's perfect for any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, toss the beef with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add the beef and cook until browned.
Add the broccoli and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until tender-crisp.
Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and easy weeknight dinner that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, celery, and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in lentils, diced tomatoes, cumin, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes, until the lentils are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and nutritious soup that's perfect for a cozy night in.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Baked Zucchini Fries
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a shallow dish, mix breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Dip the zucchini sticks in the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
Place the coated zucchini sticks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden and crispy.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier alternative to traditional fries, with a crispy coating and delicious flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Vegetable Skewers
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Thread the vegetables onto skewers.
Brush the skewers with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Grill for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and colorful appetizer that’s perfect for summer grilling.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions and reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
In a large skillet, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crispy.
Add the garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to combine with the pancetta and garlic.
Remove the skillet from the heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, tossing continuously until creamy. Add pasta water as needed.
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic Italian pasta dish with a rich and creamy sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Honey Garlic Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs, boneless and skinless
instructions: In a small bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, and minced garlic.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add chicken thighs and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
Pour the honey garlic sauce over the chicken and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
If the sauce needs thickening, mix cornstarch with water and stir into the sauce.
Serve the chicken with sauce and garnish with chopped green onions.
nutritional_facts.notes: A sweet and savory chicken dish with a delicious garlic honey glaze.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Red Pepper Soup
ingredients: 6 red bell peppers, roasted and peeled
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the roasted red peppers and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting soup with a rich red pepper flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Chili
ingredients: 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes, beans, corn, chili powder, and cumin.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and flavorful chili that's perfect for a meatless meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, cook ground beef with onion and garlic until browned.
Stir in cooked rice, diced tomatoes, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the beef mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until peppers are tender.
Top with shredded cheese if desired and bake for an additional 5 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic dish with a savory filling that can be customized with your favorite ingredients.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Curry Shrimp
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in cherry tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and creamy curry dish that’s quick and easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
instructions: Cook quinoa in water according to package instructions. Let it cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and nutritious salad that's perfect as a side dish or light meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Sweet Potato Fries
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into fries
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss the sweet potato fries with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Arrange the fries on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through, until crispy and golden.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and tasty alternative to regular fries, with a sweet and savory flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Toast
instructions: Toast the bread slices to your desired level of crispiness.
Mash the avocado in a bowl and mix in lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread the avocado mixture evenly over the toasted bread.
Top with red pepper flakes and sliced cherry tomatoes if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and healthy breakfast or snack that's quick to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Buffalo Cauliflower Bites
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour, water, garlic powder, paprika, and salt.
Dip each cauliflower floret into the batter and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden and crispy.
Toss the baked cauliflower in buffalo sauce and return to the oven for an additional 5 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A spicy and crunchy snack or appetizer that’s perfect for game day.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango Salsa
instructions: In a bowl, combine mango, red onion, red bell pepper, jalapeño, and cilantro.
Stir in lime juice and season with salt.
Chill before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and tangy salsa that's great with chips or as a topping for grilled fish or chicken.
