nutritional_facts.title: Peach Crisp
ingredients: 4 cups fresh peaches, peeled and sliced
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, toss peaches with granulated sugar and lemon juice. Transfer to a baking dish.
In another bowl, mix oats, flour, brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon until crumbly.
Sprinkle the oat mixture over the peaches.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the topping is golden and the peaches are bubbly.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warm and comforting dessert that's perfect for summer peaches.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Roasted Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Pat the chicken dry and season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff the cavity with lemon quarters and garlic.
Rub the outside of the chicken with olive oil, thyme, and rosemary.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and juicy roasted chicken with a lemon and garlic aroma.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt Smoothie
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and nutritious smoothie that's perfect for breakfast or a snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Caesar Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, toss the lettuce with Caesar dressing and lemon juice.
Add Parmesan cheese and croutons.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic salad with a creamy dressing and crunchy croutons.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Glazed Brussels Sprouts
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
In a small saucepan, heat balsamic vinegar and honey until reduced and thickened.
Drizzle the balsamic glaze over the roasted Brussels sprouts before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A tangy and sweet side dish that's perfect for any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
instructions: Blend avocados in a food processor until smooth.
Add cocoa powder, honey or maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until well combined and smooth.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A rich and creamy dessert that's surprisingly healthy.

nutritional_facts.title: Cucumber Mint Water
instructions: In a pitcher, combine cucumber slices and mint leaves.
Pour in the water and stir gently.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to infuse the flavors.
Serve over ice cubes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and hydrating drink that's perfect for hot days.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Sweet Potato Stew
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add sweet potato, lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, cumin, and paprika.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes, until lentils and sweet potato are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and nutritious stew packed with protein and fiber.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and protein-rich salad that’s perfect for a light meal or side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove stems from mushrooms and scoop out gills.
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, diced tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each mushroom cap with the quinoa mixture.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 20-25 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A savory and satisfying appetizer or side dish with a delicious cheesy topping.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Chia Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, mix chia seeds, coconut milk, honey, and vanilla extract.
Stir well and let sit for 5 minutes, then stir again.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Top with fresh fruit before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and nutritious dessert that's rich in omega-3 fatty acids.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Falafel
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, baking powder, flour, salt, and pepper.
Process until smooth, then form into small balls.
Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and brush with olive oil.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier baked version of traditional falafel with a delicious herb flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Marinara
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half and scoop out seeds.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place cut side down on a baking sheet and bake for 40-45 minutes.
Scrape the flesh with a fork to create strands.
Heat marinara sauce in a pan and stir in minced garlic.
Toss the spaghetti squash with marinara sauce and top with Parmesan cheese.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional spaghetti with a rich and savory sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
Fresh cilantro and lime for garnish
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato cubes with olive oil, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a bowl, mix roasted sweet potatoes with black beans.
Serve in taco shells and garnish with fresh cilantro and lime.
nutritional_facts.notes: A delicious and hearty vegetarian taco filling with a mix of sweet and spicy flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Chicken and Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Add garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, cornstarch, and water.
Pour sauce over the stir-fry and cook until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and healthy stir-fry that's perfect for a busy weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal
instructions: In a saucepan, bring water to a boil.
Add oats and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in diced apple, cinnamon, and honey.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the apples are tender.
Top with chopped nuts if desired.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warm and comforting breakfast that's perfect for a chilly morning.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Red Pepper Hummus
instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, roasted red peppers, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
Blend until smooth, adding olive oil slowly.
Season with salt to taste.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and creamy hummus with a hint of roasted red pepper.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix spinach, feta cheese, and garlic.
Cut a pocket into each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach mixture.
Season the outside of the chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet and sear the chicken breasts on both sides.
Transfer to the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A juicy and flavorful chicken dish with a savory spinach and feta filling.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender.
Stir in basil pesto and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to pasta with a flavorful and fresh pesto sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea and Spinach Curry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add diced tomatoes and coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Add chickpeas and spinach and cook until spinach is wilted and chickpeas are heated through.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting curry that's full of flavor and nutrients.

nutritional_facts.title: Turkey and Veggie Meatballs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine ground turkey, zucchini, carrot, parsley, breadcrumbs, egg, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Form mixture into meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Brush with olive oil and bake for 20-25 minutes, until cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and tasty meatball recipe packed with veggies.

nutritional_facts.title: Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Dip eggplant slices in olive oil and coat with a mixture of breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
In a baking dish, layer eggplant slices with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
Bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic Italian dish that's both comforting and delicious.

nutritional_facts.title: Thai Peanut Chicken Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into cubes
instructions: In a bowl, mix peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger, and lime juice.
Thread chicken cubes onto skewers and brush with peanut sauce.
Grill over medium heat for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Serve with extra peanut sauce on the side.
nutritional_facts.notes: Flavorful and juicy chicken skewers with a creamy peanut sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Berry Almond Overnight Oats
instructions: In a jar or container, combine oats and almond milk.
Stir in mixed berries, almond butter, and honey.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Top with sliced almonds before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and convenient breakfast with a satisfying crunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Potatoes
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss potatoes with olive oil, garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: Crispy and flavorful roasted potatoes with a cheesy garlic touch.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango Chicken Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, chicken, mango, red onion, and almonds.
Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and vibrant salad with a sweet and tangy dressing.

nutritional_facts.title: Pumpkin Soup
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add pumpkin puree, vegetable broth, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream if using, and serve warm.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting soup with warm spices.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Egg Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine chopped eggs, avocado, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice.
Mix until well combined and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped chives before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and flavorful twist on traditional egg salad.

nutritional_facts.title: Tomato Basil Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add tomatoes and vegetable broth, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in fresh basil and use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A classic and comforting soup with fresh basil flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Pesto Zoodles
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender.
Stir in basil pesto and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with cherry tomatoes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and low-carb pasta alternative with vibrant pesto flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa-Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1/2 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the bell peppers and place them in a baking dish.
Sprinkle with cheese if desired.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until the peppers are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A nutritious and colorful dish that's both filling and full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Shrimp Curry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté until softened.
Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add coconut milk, fish sauce, and lime juice, and bring to a simmer.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A rich and creamy shrimp curry with a tropical twist.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Sweet Potato Fries
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, cut into fries
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, toss the sweet potato fries with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the fries in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, turning halfway through, until crispy.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier alternative to traditional fries with a sweet and savory flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt Chicken Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine Greek yogurt, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice.
Add diced chicken, celery, and red onion, and mix until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier version of chicken salad that's perfect for sandwiches or wraps.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Mushroom Frittata
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add mushrooms and cook until softened.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and cook until the edges are set.
Sprinkle with feta cheese and transfer to the oven.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until the eggs are fully set.
nutritional_facts.notes: A versatile and protein-packed breakfast that's easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea and Avocado Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, and toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and nutritious salad that's perfect for a light lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Cajun Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, Cajun seasoning, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the seasoning mixture.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes on each side, until cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and spicy salmon dish that's perfect for a healthy dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Vegetable Soup
instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion, garlic, carrots, and celery until softened.
Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, cumin, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes, until lentils are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and filling soup that's packed with protein and fiber.

nutritional_facts.title: Blueberry Almond Smoothie
instructions: In a blender, combine blueberries, almond milk, Greek yogurt, almond butter, honey, and vanilla extract.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and nutritious smoothie that's perfect for breakfast or a snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Turmeric Roasted Cauliflower
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower florets with olive oil, turmeric, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread the cauliflower on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A vibrant and flavorful side dish that's full of anti-inflammatory benefits.

nutritional_facts.title: Caprese Stuffed Chicken Breast
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut a pocket into each chicken breast.
Stuff each chicken breast with mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, and basil leaves.
Secure with toothpicks if necessary.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear the chicken on both sides until browned.
Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, until cooked through.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A delicious and elegant dish that's perfect for dinner parties.

nutritional_facts.title: Moroccan-Spiced Carrot Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine grated carrots, raisins, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A vibrant and flavorful salad with a hint of sweetness from the raisins.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodle Alfredo
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese, and cook until the sauce thickens.
Add zucchini noodles and toss to coat with the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh parsley.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and low-carb alternative to traditional Alfredo pasta.

nutritional_facts.title: Cucumber Mint Lemonade
instructions: In a blender, combine cucumber slices, mint leaves, lemon juice, honey, and 2 cups of water.
Blend until smooth.
Strain the mixture into a pitcher and add the remaining water.
Serve over ice.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and hydrating drink that's perfect for hot summer days.

nutritional_facts.title: Sesame Tofu Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add tofu and cook until golden and crispy on all sides.
Remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add bell pepper, zucchini, and carrot, and stir-fry until tender.
Stir in soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil.
Return the tofu to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and protein-packed vegan stir-fry.

nutritional_facts.title: Berry Chia Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together chia seeds, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Let the mixture sit for 10 minutes, then stir again to prevent clumping.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Serve with mixed berries on top.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and satisfying dessert that's rich in omega-3s and fiber.

nutritional_facts.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, olives, feta cheese, and cucumber.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and refreshing salad that's perfect for a healthy lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Pesto
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 35-40 minutes, until tender.
Use a fork to scrape out the strands of squash.
In a large bowl, toss the spaghetti squash with pesto, cherry tomatoes, and Parmesan cheese.
nutritional_facts.notes: A fresh and low-carb pasta alternative with vibrant pesto flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa-Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, corn, tomatoes, cheese, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the mixture into the bell peppers.
Place the peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until peppers are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and filling dish that’s perfect for meal prep.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Falafel with Tahini Sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a food processor, blend chickpeas, parsley, garlic, cumin, coriander, flour, olive oil, salt, and pepper until a dough forms.
Form small patties and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Whisk together tahini, lemon juice, and water to make the sauce.
Serve falafel with tahini sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier version of the traditional fried falafel.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Tuna Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine tuna, avocado, red onion, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss gently to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and healthy salad that’s high in protein and healthy fats.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Shrimp Curry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in curry powder and turmeric.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 3 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with cilantro before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and flavorful dish that’s perfect over rice.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash Bolognese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
Place cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 40 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 15 minutes.
Scrape out squash strands with a fork and serve topped with the Bolognese sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional pasta with a rich and hearty sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt Chicken Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chicken, Greek yogurt, celery, walnuts, apple, lemon juice, and Dijon mustard.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss until well combined.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and tangy chicken salad that's perfect for sandwiches or wraps.

nutritional_facts.title: Butternut Squash and Kale Frittata
ingredients: 1 small butternut squash, peeled and diced
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium heat.
Add butternut squash and cook until tender.
Stir in kale and cook until wilted.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, until set.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and nutritious frittata that's perfect for any meal of the day.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa and Black Bean Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rub sweet potatoes with olive oil and pierce with a fork.
Bake directly on the oven rack for 45-50 minutes, until tender.
In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, salsa, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Cut the sweet potatoes in half and scoop out some of the flesh.
Fill with the quinoa mixture and top with cheese.
Return to the oven and bake for 10 more minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A satisfying and nutrient-rich meal that combines sweet and savory flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Chickpeas and Avocado Toast
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until crispy.
Toast the bread slices.
Spread mashed avocado on each slice.
Top with roasted chickpeas and a drizzle of lemon juice.
nutritional_facts.notes: A protein-packed and flavorful twist on traditional avocado toast.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Spinach Curry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in curry powder and turmeric.
Add lentils and enough water to cover.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Stir in spinach and coconut milk, and cook until spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warm and comforting curry that’s perfect for a vegetarian meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Tomato Basil Sauce
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in cherry tomatoes and cook until they begin to soften.
Add zucchini noodles and toss until just tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese on top.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and fresh pasta alternative that’s packed with flavor.

1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained

Add zucchini noodles and toss until just tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese on top.
nutritional_facts.notes: A light and fresh pasta alternative that’s packed with flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Miso-Glazed Salmon with Bok Choy
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together miso paste, soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, and sesame oil.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Place salmon on a baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes.
Meanwhile, sauté bok choy in a pan with a little sesame oil until wilted.
Serve the salmon with the bok choy.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and healthy dish that’s rich in omega-3 fatty acids.

nutritional_facts.title: Spiced Lentil and Carrot Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in cumin and coriander.
Add carrots, lentils, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until lentils and carrots are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Puree the soup with an immersion blender until smooth.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warming and nutritious soup that’s perfect for a cold day.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Vegetable and Hummus Wrap
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (zucchini, bell peppers, mushrooms), sliced
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Toss vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill vegetables until tender and slightly charred.
Spread hummus on each tortilla.
Top with grilled vegetables and crumbled feta cheese.
Roll up the tortillas and serve.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and easy wrap that’s perfect for lunch or a light dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 medium cauliflower, grated into rice-sized pieces
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in mixed vegetables and cook until tender.
Push vegetables to one side and pour in beaten eggs, scrambling them as they cook.
Add grated cauliflower and stir to combine.
Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil, and cook for another 5-7 minutes, until cauliflower is tender.
Garnish with chopped green onion.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional fried rice that’s packed with flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Spicy Chickpea and Avocado Sandwich
instructions: In a bowl, mash chickpeas with a fork until slightly chunky.
Stir in mashed avocado, red onion, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread the mixture on two slices of bread and top with the remaining slices.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and flavorful sandwich that’s rich in protein and healthy fats.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, spinach, feta cheese, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Brush mushrooms with olive oil and place them on a baking sheet.
Stuff the mushrooms with the quinoa mixture.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until mushrooms are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A delicious and filling vegetarian dish that’s packed with nutrients.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Roasted Brussels Sprouts
ingredients: 1 lb Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly crispy.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and delicious side dish that pairs well with any main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender.
In a bowl, mix roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, diced tomatoes, and cilantro.
Warm the tortillas and fill with the sweet potato mixture.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthy and filling vegetarian taco that’s full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango and Black Bean Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, mango, black beans, red onion, and cilantro.
Drizzle with lime juice and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss until well combined.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and colorful salad that’s perfect for a light meal or side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Tofu with Peanut Sauce
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, drained and pressed
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Cut tofu into slices and brush with sesame oil.
Grill tofu slices for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, garlic, and ginger.
Serve tofu with the peanut sauce drizzled on top.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and protein-packed dish that’s perfect for vegetarians.

nutritional_facts.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Sprinkle with dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss until well combined.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and hearty salad that’s full of Mediterranean flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, cook pancetta until crispy. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan.
Toss cooked spaghetti with pancetta and garlic.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture, allowing heat to cook the eggs.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A rich and creamy Italian pasta dish with a deliciously cheesy flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, olives, feta, and red onion.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing salad with vibrant Mediterranean flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: In a pot, heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add butternut squash and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender.
Puree the soup with an immersion blender.
Stir in coconut milk and season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and comforting soup that's perfect for fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and tikka masala spice for at least 1 hour.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add marinated chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in diced tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add heavy cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Season with salt.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Salad with Avocado

Toss to combine.

1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water

Add beef and cook until browned.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender.
Stir in soy sauce and hoisin sauce.
Add cornstarch mixture and cook until sauce thickens.

In an oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil and sauté vegetables until tender.
Pour egg mixture over vegetables and cook for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle cheese on top and transfer skillet to the oven.
