Pulse florets in a food processor until it resembles rice.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and cook cauliflower rice until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional rice.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Chickpeas
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, paprika, cumin, and salt.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until crispy.
nutritional_facts.notes: A crunchy and healthy snack that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Sweet Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rub sweet potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 45-50 minutes, until tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: Simple and nutritious, these sweet potatoes are great as a side or topped with your favorite ingredients.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea Salad Sandwich
instructions: In a bowl, mix mashed chickpeas, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, celery, and red onion.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve on bread slices as a sandwich.
nutritional_facts.notes: A vegetarian alternative to tuna salad sandwiches.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 bell peppers, tops removed and seeds discarded
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix rice, black beans, corn, salsa, and half of the cheese.
Stuff peppers with mixture and place in a baking dish.
Top with remaining cheese and bake for 30-35 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A colorful and nutritious meal that’s easy to customize.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Toast
ingredients: Optional toppings: cherry tomatoes, radishes, or poached egg
instructions: Toast bread slices.
Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread avocado mixture on toast and add optional toppings.
nutritional_facts.notes: A quick and easy breakfast that’s both satisfying and healthy.

nutritional_facts.title: Eggplant Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Dip eggplant slices in beaten egg, then coat with bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Layer eggplant slices in a baking dish with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A comforting and satisfying dish that’s great with a side salad.

nutritional_facts.title: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal
instructions: In a pot, combine oats, milk, apple, and cinnamon.
Cook over medium heat until oats are tender.
Stir in honey and top with optional toppings.
nutritional_facts.notes: A warm and hearty breakfast that’s perfect for cool mornings.

nutritional_facts.title: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and satisfying smoothie that’s great for a quick breakfast.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
instructions: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté zucchini noodles for 2-3 minutes.
Toss with pesto sauce and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Top with Parmesan cheese before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb and flavorful alternative to traditional pasta dishes.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Glazed Brussels Sprouts
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and caramelized.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A tangy and sweet side dish that's perfect for any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Marinara
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut spaghetti squash in half and remove seeds.
Place cut-side down on a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes.
Use a fork to scrape out the strands of squash.
Mix with marinara sauce and top with Parmesan cheese.
Garnish with fresh basil.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional pasta dishes.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Chicken Salad
instructions: Mash avocado with Greek yogurt and lime juice.
Mix in chicken and cilantro.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and healthy chicken salad option.

nutritional_facts.title: Thai Peanut Noodles
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.
In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, and lime juice.
Toss noodles with peanut sauce and shredded carrots.
Top with chopped peanuts before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and easy noodle dish with a creamy peanut sauce.

nutritional_facts.title: Kale and Quinoa Bowl
instructions: In a bowl, mix quinoa, kale, cranberries, pumpkin seeds, and feta.
Whisk together olive oil and balsamic vinegar, and toss with salad.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A nutritious and filling salad that's perfect for lunch or dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Chicken and Vegetable Skewers
instructions: In a bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Add chicken and vegetables, and toss to coat.
Thread onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 10-12 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A simple and healthy grilling option that's perfect for summer.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, garlic, and parsley.
Stuff mushrooms with mixture and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until mushrooms are tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A delicious and easy-to-make appetizer that's perfect for parties.

nutritional_facts.title: Black Bean Soup
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a pot, sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add black beans, tomatoes, vegetable broth, cumin, and paprika.
Simmer for 20 minutes, then blend until smooth if desired.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A hearty and flavorful soup that's easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Berry Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Toppings: granola, fresh berries, chia seeds
instructions: Blend frozen berries, banana, Greek yogurt, and almond milk until smooth.
Pour into a bowl and top with granola, fresh berries, and chia seeds.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and healthy breakfast option that's customizable with your favorite toppings.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato Fries
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into fries
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss sweet potato fries with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier alternative to regular fries that's still crispy and delicious.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 bell peppers, tops removed and seeds discarded
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix quinoa, black beans, corn, and salsa.
Stuff peppers with the mixture and place in a baking dish.
Top with cheese and bake for 30 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A nutritious and satisfying meal that's easy to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic Roasted Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss potatoes with olive oil, garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and tender.
nutritional_facts.notes: A flavorful and easy side dish that's great with any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Cucumber and Avocado Soup
instructions: Blend cucumber, avocado, vegetable broth, Greek yogurt, and lemon juice until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: A refreshing and creamy soup that's perfect for a light lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Almond-Crusted Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season salmon with salt and pepper.
Dip in beaten egg, then coat with almond meal and Parmesan cheese.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A crunchy and healthy way to prepare salmon.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Chicken Tenders
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, and paprika.
Dip chicken tenders in beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumb mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A healthier version of a classic favorite.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Zucchini Boats
ingredients: 4 zucchini, halved and seeds scooped out
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix ground turkey with marinara sauce.
Stuff zucchini halves with mixture and top with mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb and flavorful meal that's easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Creamy Avocado Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a blender, combine avocados, basil, garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil.
Blend until smooth and season with salt and pepper.
Toss pasta with avocado sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and dairy-free pasta sauce alternative.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Red Pepper Soup
ingredients: 4 red bell peppers, roasted and peeled
instructions: In a pot, sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add roasted red peppers and vegetable broth.
Simmer for 20 minutes, then blend until smooth.
Stir in cream and season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: A rich and flavorful soup with a hint of creaminess.

nutritional_facts.title: Ginger-Lime Shrimp
instructions: In a bowl, mix lime juice, ginger, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Add shrimp and marinate for 15-20 minutes.
Grill or sauté shrimp until pink and cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A zesty and flavorful shrimp dish that's quick to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Pizza Crust
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, mix riced cauliflower, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Press mixture onto a baking sheet into a crust shape.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, then add toppings and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: A low-carb alternative to traditional pizza crust.

nutritional_facts.title: Pumpkin Spice Smoothie
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
nutritional_facts.notes: A creamy and seasonal smoothie that's perfect for fall.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet and Sour Chicken
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and cornstarch.
Heat oil in a pan and cook chicken until browned.
Add bell pepper and pineapple, then pour sauce over.
Simmer until sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
nutritional_facts.notes: A tangy and sweet dish that's great over rice.

nutritional_facts.title: Moroccan Chickpea Stew
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in cumin, coriander, cinnamon, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add carrots, zucchini, and red bell pepper, and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in vegetable broth and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add chickpeas and raisins, and simmer for another 10 minutes, until vegetables are tender and flavors are well combined.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This hearty stew is packed with warm spices and is perfect for a cozy dinner. Serve with couscous or crusty bread.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, salt, pepper, and oregano.
Cut a slit in each chicken breast to create a pocket. Stuff each pocket with the spinach and feta mixture.
Use toothpicks to seal the edges of the chicken breasts.
Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Add a bit of oil and sear the chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Remove toothpicks before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This stuffed chicken breast is a flavorful and healthy option that's great for a special dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Thai Peanut Quinoa Bowl
instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring quinoa and water to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until quinoa is cooked and water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and set aside to cool slightly.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, ginger, garlic, and water until smooth.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, shredded carrots, sliced bell pepper, cucumber, cilantro, peanuts, and green onions.
Drizzle the peanut sauce over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Serve immediately, or refrigerate for up to 2 days.
nutritional_facts.notes: This Thai-inspired quinoa bowl is a great balance of flavors and textures, with a creamy peanut sauce that ties it all together.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Cauliflower Tacos with Chipotle Sauce
ingredients: 1 large head cauliflower, cut into florets
1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss cauliflower florets with olive oil, cumin, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until evenly coated.
Spread the cauliflower on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender and golden brown.
Meanwhile, prepare the chipotle sauce by mixing Greek yogurt, minced chipotle pepper, and lime juice in a small bowl.
Warm the corn tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat.
To assemble the tacos, place a portion of roasted cauliflower on each tortilla. Top with shredded cabbage, avocado slices, and fresh cilantro. Drizzle with chipotle sauce.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: These vegetarian tacos are packed with flavor and are a healthy alternative to traditional tacos.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Sweet Potato Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until lentils are tender and broth is absorbed. Set aside.
In a large skillet, sauté onion, garlic, carrots, and celery until softened, about 10 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes, then add cooked lentils.
Meanwhile, boil sweet potatoes in a large pot of water until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and mash with butter and milk until smooth.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Spread the lentil mixture in the bottom of a baking dish. Top with mashed sweet potatoes, spreading evenly.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the top is slightly browned.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetarian version of shepherd's pie is hearty, comforting, and packed with nutrients.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Glazed Brussels Sprouts
ingredients: 1 lb Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until browned and crispy.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat balsamic vinegar and honey over medium heat. Simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Drizzle the balsamic glaze over the roasted Brussels sprouts and sprinkle with chopped pecans.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: These roasted Brussels sprouts are a delicious and healthy side dish, with a sweet and tangy glaze.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Curry Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in red curry paste and ground ginger. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add cubed butternut squash and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, until the squash is tender.
Stir in coconut milk and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This creamy and flavorful soup is perfect for a cozy meal. The coconut and curry flavors complement the sweetness of the butternut squash beautifully.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium saucepan, bring quinoa and vegetable broth to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until quinoa is cooked and broth is absorbed. Set aside.
In a large skillet, sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add zucchini, black beans, corn, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cooked quinoa.
Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish.
If using cheese, sprinkle it on top of the stuffed peppers.
Cover the dish with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed bell peppers are a nutritious and satisfying meal, with a hearty quinoa and vegetable filling.

nutritional_facts.title: Mushroom and Spinach Risotto
instructions: In a medium saucepan, heat vegetable broth and keep warm over low heat.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes, until softened.
Stir in Arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes, until the rice is lightly toasted.
Pour in white wine and cook until absorbed, stirring constantly.

Add warm vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly until each addition is absorbed before adding the next. Continue this process until the rice is creamy and tender, about 18-20 minutes.
Stir in fresh spinach and grated Parmesan cheese, and cook until the spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This creamy and flavorful risotto is a comforting dish that's perfect for a special dinner. The combination of mushrooms and spinach adds a nice earthy flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over the chicken. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade and grill for 6-8 minutes per side, until the chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Remove from grill and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
nutritional_facts.notes: This simple and flavorful grilled chicken is perfect for a quick and healthy dinner. The lemon and herbs add a bright, fresh flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Tofu
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, drained and cubed
Cooked rice or noodles, for serving
instructions: In a small bowl, toss cubed tofu with 2 tablespoons of soy sauce and sesame oil. Let marinate for 10 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook until golden brown on all sides. Remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add red bell pepper, zucchini, broccoli, and carrot, and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, and grated ginger.
Return tofu to the skillet and pour the sauce over the stir-fry. Toss to combine and cook for an additional 2 minutes, until heated through.
Serve hot over cooked rice or noodles.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetable stir-fry with tofu is a quick and healthy meal that's packed with flavor. It's easily customizable with your favorite vegetables.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Baked Falafel
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking powder, flour, salt, and pepper. Pulse until the mixture is well combined but still slightly chunky.
Form the mixture into small patties or balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Lightly spray the falafel with olive oil.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the falafel is golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot in pita bread with your favorite toppings, or over a salad.
nutritional_facts.notes: These crispy baked falafel are a healthier alternative to the traditional fried version. They make a great addition to salads, sandwiches, or grain bowls.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring quinoa and water to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until quinoa is cooked and water is absorbed. Let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, red bell pepper, avocado, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
nutritional_facts.notes: This quinoa and black bean salad is a refreshing and protein-packed dish that's perfect for a light lunch or a side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, toss halved potatoes with minced garlic, olive oil, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Spread the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy, stirring halfway through.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: These garlic and herb roasted potatoes are a simple and delicious side dish that pairs well with almost any main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Place cut-side down on a baking sheet and bake for 40-45 minutes, until tender.
Use a fork to scrape the spaghetti-like strands from the squash and transfer them to a large bowl.
Add halved cherry tomatoes, basil pesto, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Toss to combine.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This low-carb dish is a great alternative to traditional pasta. The pesto and cherry tomatoes add a burst of fresh flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini Noodles with Avocado Sauce
instructions: In a food processor, combine avocados, basil, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy.
In a large bowl, toss zucchini noodles with the avocado sauce until evenly coated.
Serve immediately, garnished with toasted pine nuts.
nutritional_facts.notes: These zucchini noodles with avocado sauce are a healthy and delicious alternative to traditional pasta, perfect for a light and refreshing meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Acorn Squash with Wild Rice
ingredients: 2 acorn squashes, halved and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place the acorn squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes, until tender.
In a large bowl, combine cooked wild rice, dried cranberries, chopped pecans, parsley, olive oil, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the rice mixture into the roasted acorn squash halves.
Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until heated through.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This stuffed acorn squash is a beautiful and nutritious dish, perfect for a holiday meal or special occasion.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Add the shrimp and toss to coat. Marinate for 15-20 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Thread the shrimp onto the soaked wooden skewers.
Grill the shrimp skewers for 2-3 minutes per side, until the shrimp are pink and opaque.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.
nutritional_facts.notes: These lemon garlic shrimp skewers are a quick and flavorful option for grilling. They can also be cooked under the broiler if you don't have a grill.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango Black Bean Salsa
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine diced mangoes, black beans, red onion, red bell pepper, jalapeño, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Toss to combine.
Serve immediately, or refrigerate for up to 2 days.
nutritional_facts.notes: This mango black bean salsa is a fresh and vibrant side dish that's perfect for summer. It's great with chips, on tacos, or as a topping for grilled chicken or fish.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, grated into rice-sized pieces
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add grated cauliflower and frozen peas and carrots to the skillet. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Scramble the eggs until cooked, then stir them into the vegetables.
Stir in soy sauce and rice vinegar, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Garnish with sliced green onions before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This cauliflower fried rice is a low-carb and vegetable-packed alternative to traditional fried rice. It's quick to make and full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss zucchini, bell pepper, onion, and cherry tomatoes with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dried basil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These balsamic roasted vegetables are a versatile and delicious side dish that pairs well with almost any main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Spicy Thai Peanut Noodles
instructions: Cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, sriracha, and minced garlic.
In a large bowl, toss the cooked noodles with the peanut sauce, chopped peanuts, cilantro, green onions, and red bell pepper.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: These spicy Thai peanut noodles are a quick and flavorful dish that’s perfect for a weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Enchiladas
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, toss diced sweet potatoes with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender.
In a large bowl, combine roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, corn, and cheese (if using).
Fill each tortilla with the sweet potato mixture, roll up, and place seam-side down in a baking dish.
Pour enchilada sauce over the tortillas and bake for 20 minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: These enchiladas are packed with flavor and are a great vegetarian option for a family dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Cauliflower Tacos with Avocado Crema
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss cauliflower florets with olive oil, smoked paprika, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the cauliflower on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and tender.
In a blender, combine avocado, Greek yogurt, lime juice, and cilantro. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Warm the tortillas and fill each with roasted cauliflower. Top with avocado crema and additional cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: These cauliflower tacos are a healthy and delicious alternative to traditional tacos, with a creamy avocado crema that adds a refreshing touch.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea and Spinach Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, spinach, cooked quinoa, feta cheese, tomato sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the chickpea mixture and place in a baking dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed peppers are a great vegetarian meal that's packed with protein and flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken breasts and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, until cooked through.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This lemon herb grilled chicken is juicy, flavorful, and perfect for a summer barbecue.

nutritional_facts.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1/4 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and sliced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, red onion, cherry tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This Mediterranean chickpea salad is light, refreshing, and full of vibrant flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Zucchini and Carrot Fritters
instructions: In a large bowl, combine grated zucchini, grated carrots, flour, beaten eggs, green onions, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Drop spoonfuls of the zucchini and carrot mixture into the skillet, flattening each fritter slightly with a spatula.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: These zucchini and carrot fritters are a delicious and healthy appetizer, perfect for entertaining.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Black Bean Quesadillas
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet and layer with black beans, avocado slices, shredded cheese (if using), salsa, and cilantro.
Top with another tortilla and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas.
Cut into wedges and serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These avocado and black bean quesadillas are a quick and satisfying meal that's perfect for lunch or dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Zucchini Boats
ingredients: 4 large zucchinis, halved lengthwise and seeds scooped out
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, cook the ground turkey or beef over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked quinoa, tomato sauce, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each zucchini half with the meat mixture and place in a baking dish.
Sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed zucchini boats are a healthy and flavorful way to enjoy a low-carb meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breasts
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, combine chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Slice a pocket into each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach and feta mixture.
Secure with toothpicks.
In a large oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the stuffed chicken breasts and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until browned.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove the toothpicks before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: These spinach and feta stuffed chicken breasts are juicy, flavorful, and perfect for a special dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the cubed butternut squash and chopped carrot with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large pot, heat a little olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the roasted butternut squash and carrot to the pot, along with the vegetable broth, ground cumin, and ground nutmeg.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth and creamy.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted butternut squash soup is creamy, comforting, and perfect for a cozy fall meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Lentil and Mushroom Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the sliced mushrooms and chopped carrot to the skillet and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked lentils, frozen peas, vegetable broth, tomato paste, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Transfer the lentil mixture to a baking dish and spread evenly.
Top with mashed potatoes, spreading them evenly over the lentil mixture.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This lentil and mushroom shepherd's pie is a hearty and satisfying vegetarian version of the classic dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Thai Coconut Chicken Soup (Tom Kha Gai)
ingredients: 2 stalks lemongrass, bruised and cut into pieces
instructions: In a large pot, combine chicken broth, coconut milk, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Add the sliced chicken, minced garlic, and mushrooms. Cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the fish sauce, lime juice, and sliced red chilies.
Remove from heat and discard the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This Thai coconut chicken soup is rich, fragrant, and bursting with flavors. Perfect for a warm, comforting meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Mediterranean Stuffed Eggplant
ingredients: 1/4 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and sliced
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Scoop out the flesh of the eggplants, leaving a 1/4-inch border, and chop the flesh.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped eggplant flesh and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the sautéed eggplant, cooked quinoa, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, olives, feta cheese, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each eggplant half with the quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the eggplants are tender.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: These Mediterranean stuffed eggplants are a healthy and flavorful dish that's perfect for a vegetarian main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Shrimp Salad
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes per side.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked shrimp, diced avocado, cucumber, red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This avocado and shrimp salad is light, refreshing, and perfect for a summer meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms with Spinach and Ricotta
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped spinach and sauté until wilted, about 3 minutes.
In a bowl, combine the sautéed spinach, ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each portobello mushroom with the spinach and ricotta mixture and place in a baking dish.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed portobello mushrooms are a delicious and healthy appetizer, perfect for any occasion.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Moussaka
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Fry the sliced eggplants and potatoes until golden brown. Set aside.
In the same skillet, add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the lentils, crushed tomatoes, red wine, dried oregano, ground cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.
In a baking dish, layer the fried potatoes, lentil mixture, and fried eggplants.
Pour the béchamel sauce over the top and sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until golden and bubbly.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetarian moussaka is a hearty and flavorful dish that's perfect for a special dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa and Sweet Potato Cakes
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and grated
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, grated sweet potato, breadcrumbs, green onions, feta cheese, beaten egg, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
Form the mixture into small cakes.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Fry the quinoa and sweet potato cakes for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
nutritional_facts.notes: These quinoa and sweet potato cakes are a healthy and delicious appetizer, perfect for any occasion.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Stir in the lemon juice, cooked spaghetti, fresh parsley, salt, and pepper.
Toss to combine and serve hot, garnished with Parmesan cheese.
nutritional_facts.notes: This lemon garlic shrimp pasta is a quick and flavorful dish that's perfect for a weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Cauliflower and Chickpea Tacos
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss cauliflower florets and chickpeas with olive oil, ground cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the cauliflower and chickpeas on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and tender.
Warm the tortillas and fill each with roasted cauliflower and chickpeas.
Top with fresh cilantro, salsa, and a dollop of Greek yogurt (if using).
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These roasted cauliflower and chickpea tacos are a healthy and flavorful vegetarian option for taco night.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Pineapple and Chicken Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into cubes
1 pineapple, peeled, cored, and cut into chunks
1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
1 green bell pepper, cut into chunks
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, lime juice, minced garlic, and ground ginger.
Add the chicken cubes to the marinade and let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
Thread the marinated chicken, pineapple chunks, and bell peppers onto the skewers.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the pineapple is caramelized.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These grilled pineapple and chicken skewers are a sweet and savory dish that's perfect for a summer barbecue.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Peppers with Couscous
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine cooked couscous, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, fresh parsley, tomato sauce, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the couscous mixture and place in a baking dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These vegetarian stuffed peppers with couscous are a healthy and delicious main course that's perfect for any occasion.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Garlic and Parmesan Mashed Cauliflower
ingredients: 1 large head cauliflower, chopped into florets
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss the cauliflower florets and garlic cloves with a little olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender.
In a large pot, combine the roasted cauliflower and garlic with the Parmesan cheese, Greek yogurt, and butter.
Using an immersion blender, blend until smooth and creamy.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh chives.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted garlic and Parmesan mashed cauliflower is a healthy and flavorful alternative to traditional mashed potatoes.

nutritional_facts.title: Spicy Tofu Stir-Fry with Vegetables
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: In a large skillet, heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add the cubed tofu and cook until golden brown on all sides. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the minced garlic, sliced bell peppers, zucchini, and carrot. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked tofu, soy sauce, sriracha sauce, hoisin sauce, and ground ginger. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until everything is heated through.
Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This spicy tofu stir-fry with vegetables is a quick and healthy meal that's full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Creamy Garlic Parmesan Risotto
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat with the oil and butter.
Pour in the white wine and cook until the liquid is absorbed.
Gradually add the broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next.
Continue cooking and stirring until the rice is creamy and tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
nutritional_facts.notes: This creamy garlic Parmesan risotto is a comforting and elegant dish that's perfect for a special dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Caprese Salad with Balsamic Reduction
instructions: In a small saucepan, bring the balsamic vinegar to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer until the vinegar has thickened and reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.
On a large platter, arrange the tomato slices and mozzarella slices in an alternating pattern.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and the balsamic reduction.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: This Caprese salad with balsamic reduction is a fresh and flavorful appetizer that's perfect for any occasion.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Carefully remove large cabbage leaves and blanch them in boiling water for 2-3 minutes to soften. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, grated carrots, and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
In a large bowl, combine the sautéed vegetables, cooked rice, cooked lentils, dried thyme, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place a spoonful of the mixture in the center of each cabbage leaf and roll up, tucking in the sides to secure.
In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of crushed tomatoes.
Place the cabbage rolls seam-side down in the dish and cover with the remaining crushed tomatoes.
Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These vegetarian stuffed cabbage rolls are a hearty and flavorful dish that's perfect for a comforting meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Black Bean and Corn Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the black beans, corn kernels, diced red bell pepper, diced red onion, fresh cilantro, and diced avocado.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This black bean and corn salad is a fresh and flavorful side dish that's perfect for a summer meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the thinly sliced garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until the garlic is golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat with the garlic oil.
Stir in the fresh parsley, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
nutritional_facts.notes: This spaghetti aglio e olio is a simple and flavorful pasta dish that's perfect for a quick and easy dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Enchiladas
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, toss the cubed sweet potatoes with olive oil, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large bowl, combine the roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, corn kernels, and salsa.
Spoon the sweet potato mixture into each corn tortilla and roll up.
Place the enchiladas seam-side down in a baking dish and sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: These sweet potato and black bean enchiladas are a delicious and healthy vegetarian option for a Mexican-inspired meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Vegetable and Hummus Wrap
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and red onion with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill the vegetables until tender and slightly charred, about 5-7 minutes.
Spread a layer of hummus on each whole wheat tortilla.
Top with grilled vegetables and fresh spinach leaves.
Roll up the tortillas and serve hot or cold.
nutritional_facts.notes: These grilled vegetable and hummus wraps are a healthy and flavorful option for a quick and easy lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Acorn Squash
ingredients: 2 acorn squashes, halved and seeds removed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place the halved acorn squashes cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, dried cranberries, chopped walnuts, feta cheese, fresh parsley, vegetable broth, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each acorn squash half with the quinoa mixture.
Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetarian stuffed acorn squash is a beautiful and delicious dish that's perfect for a fall dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegan Chocolate Avocado Mousse
instructions: In a blender or food processor, combine the ripe avocados, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Spoon the mousse into serving dishes and chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Garnish with fresh berries.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegan chocolate avocado mousse is a rich and creamy dessert that's surprisingly healthy.

nutritional_facts.title: Grilled Halloumi and Watermelon Salad
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the halloumi cheese slices with olive oil and grill for 2-3 minutes per side, until grill marks appear.
In a large bowl, combine the cubed watermelon and fresh mint leaves.
Top with the grilled halloumi cheese.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.
nutritional_facts.notes: This grilled halloumi and watermelon salad is a refreshing and unique dish that's perfect for a summer meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Black Bean Chili
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, diced red bell pepper, diced green bell pepper, and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
Stir in the chili powder, ground cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Add the black beans and diced tomatoes to the pot.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, until the flavors are well combined.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetarian black bean chili is a hearty and flavorful dish that's perfect for a comforting meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, halved cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, sliced Kalamata olives, crumbled feta cheese, and fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This Mediterranean quinoa salad is a healthy and flavorful dish that's perfect for a light lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wrap the beets in aluminum foil and roast for 45-50 minutes, until tender. Let cool, then peel and slice the beets.
In a large bowl, combine the roasted beets, crumbled goat cheese, toasted walnuts, and fresh arugula.
In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted beet and goat cheese salad is a beautiful and delicious dish that's perfect for a special meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Tacos with Avocado Crema
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced red bell pepper and red onion and sauté until softened.
Stir in the black beans, corn kernels, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes, until heated through.
In a blender or food processor, combine the ripe avocado, Greek yogurt, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Warm the corn tortillas and fill each with the black bean and corn mixture.
Drizzle with the avocado crema and garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These vegetarian tacos with avocado crema are a healthy and flavorful option for taco night.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large pot, boil the peeled and cubed potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with milk and butter. Season with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion, diced carrots, and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
Stir in the cooked lentils, frozen peas, diced tomatoes, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes, until the mixture is heated through.
Spread the lentil and vegetable mixture in a baking dish.
Top with the mashed potatoes, spreading them evenly over the filling.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetarian shepherd's pie is a comforting and hearty dish that's perfect for a cozy dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn kernels, salsa, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish.
Sprinkle the tops with shredded cheddar cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: These vegetarian stuffed bell peppers are a colorful and healthy dish that's perfect for a family dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Vegetarian Mushroom Stroganoff
instructions: Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until browned and tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the vegetable broth and Dijon mustard. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot over the cooked egg noodles, garnished with fresh parsley.
nutritional_facts.notes: This vegetarian mushroom stroganoff is a creamy and comforting dish that's perfect for a cozy dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Vegetable Lasagna
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, toss the sliced zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, sliced onion, and minced garlic with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer with lasagna noodles, roasted vegetables, cheese mixture, and marinara sauce.
Repeat the layers, ending with a layer of noodles and sauce.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted vegetable lasagna is a hearty and flavorful dish that's perfect for a family dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Baked Tofu with Soy-Ginger Glaze
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss the cubed tofu with cornstarch until evenly coated.
Spread the tofu on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, until crispy and golden brown.
In a small saucepan, combine soy sauce, maple syrup, rice vinegar, sesame oil, grated ginger, and minced garlic. Cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
Remove the tofu from the oven and toss with the soy-ginger glaze.
Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with fresh scallions.
nutritional_facts.notes: This crispy baked tofu with soy-ginger glaze is a delicious and healthy dish that's perfect for a quick and easy dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Creamy Spinach and Artichoke Pasta
ingredients: 1 can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add cream cheese and vegetable broth, stirring until smooth.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, chopped artichoke hearts, and fresh spinach.
Cook until the spinach is wilted and the sauce is creamy.
Toss the cooked pasta in the sauce. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This creamy spinach and artichoke pasta is a comforting and nutritious dish that's easy to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Balsamic Glazed Salmon
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine balsamic vinegar, honey, and minced garlic. Bring to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Sear salmon fillets for 2-3 minutes per side.
Brush the balsamic glaze over the salmon.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, until the salmon is cooked through.
Garnish with fresh thyme and serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This balsamic-glazed salmon is rich in flavor and pairs well with roasted vegetables or a fresh salad.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa-Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn kernels, shredded cheddar cheese, salsa, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the bell peppers with the quinoa mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the peppers are tender.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: These quinoa-stuffed bell peppers are a nutritious and colorful dish that's perfect for a weeknight dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wrap beets in foil and roast for 45-60 minutes, until tender. Let cool, then peel and slice.
In a large bowl, toss mixed greens with sliced beets, crumbled goat cheese, and chopped walnuts.
In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted beet and goat cheese salad is a delicious blend of earthy, tangy, and sweet flavors.

nutritional_facts.title: Spiced Lentil and Sweet Potato Stew
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in ground cumin, ground coriander, and ground turmeric, and cook for another minute.
Add lentils, cubed sweet potatoes, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes, until the lentils and sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This spiced lentil and sweet potato stew is hearty, warming, and full of flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Carrot and Hummus Wrap
ingredients: 4 large carrots, peeled and sliced into sticks
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss carrot sticks with olive oil, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and caramelized.
Spread hummus over each whole wheat tortilla.
Top with roasted carrots, shredded lettuce, sliced cucumbers, and crumbled feta cheese.
Roll up the tortillas and serve.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted carrot and hummus wrap is a healthy and satisfying meal that’s perfect for lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Chickpea and Spinach Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add sliced onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Stir in ground cumin and ground coriander, and cook for another minute.
Add chickpeas and fresh spinach. Cook until the spinach is wilted and chickpeas are heated through.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.
nutritional_facts.notes: This chickpea and spinach stir-fry is a quick and nutritious meal that's packed with flavor.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Zucchini Fries
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, and dried oregano.
Dip zucchini slices into beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumb mixture.
Place the coated zucchini fries on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Spray with olive oil spray.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with marinara sauce or your favorite dip.
nutritional_facts.notes: These baked zucchini fries are a healthier alternative to traditional fries and perfect for snacking.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Acorn Squash
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush acorn squash halves with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place squash cut-side down on a baking sheet and bake for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a bowl, combine cooked quinoa, dried cranberries, chopped walnuts, crumbled feta cheese, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Flip the squash cut-side up and fill with the quinoa mixture.
Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: This stuffed acorn squash is a festive and nutritious dish, perfect for a special dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Thai Peanut Chicken Skewers
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into cubes
Chopped peanuts and cilantro for garnish
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, grated ginger, minced garlic, and sesame oil.
Add chicken cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill for 4-5 minutes per side, until fully cooked.
Garnish with chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: These Thai peanut chicken skewers are packed with flavor and perfect for grilling season.

nutritional_facts.title: Berry Chia Seed Pudding
instructions: In a bowl, combine chia seeds, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
Stir well and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, until thickened.
Serve topped with mixed berries and garnish with mint leaves.
nutritional_facts.notes: This berry chia seed pudding is a healthy and refreshing dessert or breakfast option.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Kale Hash
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add cubed sweet potatoes, smoked paprika, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Cook for 10-12 minutes, until sweet potatoes are tender.
Stir in chopped kale and cook until wilted.
Serve hot.
nutritional_facts.notes: This sweet potato and kale hash is a flavorful and nutritious side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Greek Yogurt Chicken Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine Greek yogurt, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Add shredded chicken, diced celery, diced red onion, and chopped parsley. Stir to combine.
Serve chilled.
nutritional_facts.notes: This Greek yogurt chicken salad is a healthier alternative to traditional chicken salad, perfect for sandwiches or as a salad topping.

nutritional_facts.title: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove stems from mushrooms and scoop out the gills.
In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, and chopped basil.
Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle with olive oil.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the mixture and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until mushrooms are tender and topping is golden.
nutritional_facts.notes: These stuffed Portobello mushrooms are a savory and satisfying appetizer or side dish.

nutritional_facts.title: Coconut Curry Cauliflower
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger, and sauté until softened.
Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
Add cauliflower florets and coconut milk. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, until cauliflower is tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: This coconut curry cauliflower is a rich and flavorful dish that's perfect as a main course or side.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado and Tomato Bruschetta
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast in the oven for 5-7 minutes, until lightly golden.
In a bowl, combine diced avocado, diced cherry tomatoes, finely chopped red onion, and fresh basil.
Season with salt and pepper, and drizzle with balsamic glaze.
Top toasted baguette slices with the avocado and tomato mixture.
nutritional_facts.notes: This avocado and tomato bruschetta is a fresh and flavorful appetizer, perfect for entertaining.

nutritional_facts.title: Honey Mustard Glazed Carrots
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, whisk together honey, Dijon mustard, olive oil, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Add baby carrots and toss to coat.
Spread carrots on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and caramelized.
nutritional_facts.notes: These honey mustard glazed carrots are a sweet and tangy side dish that's perfect for any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Lemon Garlic Roasted Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rub the chicken with olive oil, minced garlic, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the cavity with lemon quarters.
Place the chicken on a roasting pan and roast for 1-1.5 hours, until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let rest before carving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This lemon garlic roasted chicken is juicy and flavorful, perfect for a family dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Mango Black Bean Salsa
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a bowl, combine diced mango, black beans, diced red bell pepper, and chopped red onion.
Add lime juice and chopped cilantro. Toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos.
nutritional_facts.notes: This mango black bean salsa is a refreshing and flavorful addition to any meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Baked Lemon Herb Cod
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place cod fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with dried oregano, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Top with lemon slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until fish flakes easily with a fork.
nutritional_facts.notes: This baked lemon herb cod is a light and flavorful main course that's easy to prepare.

nutritional_facts.title: Spaghetti Squash with Tomato Basil Sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Place cut-side down on a baking sheet and roast for 40-45 minutes, until tender.
Use a fork to scrape out the flesh into strands.
Top with tomato basil sauce and grated Parmesan cheese.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
nutritional_facts.notes: This spaghetti squash with tomato basil sauce is a healthy and delicious alternative to traditional pasta.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Slice the top off the garlic head and drizzle with olive oil. Wrap in foil and roast for 30-35 minutes, until soft.
Boil potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain.
Squeeze roasted garlic out of the cloves and add to the potatoes.
Mash potatoes with milk and butter until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: These roasted garlic mashed potatoes are a flavorful and creamy side dish that pairs well with any main course.

nutritional_facts.title: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal
instructions: In a saucepan, combine oats, milk, and water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in chopped apple and cinnamon, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in maple syrup.
Serve topped with chopped nuts.
nutritional_facts.notes: This apple cinnamon oatmeal is a warm and comforting breakfast that's easy to make.

nutritional_facts.title: Peach and Burrata Salad
instructions: On a platter, arrange arugula, peach slices, and burrata cheese.
Drizzle with honey and balsamic vinegar.
Sprinkle with toasted pine nuts, salt, and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: This peach and burrata salad is a delicious combination of sweet and savory flavors, perfect for a summer meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Spicy Thai Noodles
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add red bell pepper and snap peas, and cook until tender-crisp.
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sriracha sauce, and brown sugar.
Add cooked noodles and sauce to the skillet. Toss to combine and heat through.
Serve topped with chopped peanuts and cilantro.
nutritional_facts.notes: These spicy Thai noodles are full of flavor and have just the right amount of heat.

nutritional_facts.title: Garlic Parmesan Roasted Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a bowl, toss potatoes with olive oil, minced garlic, grated Parmesan cheese, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Spread potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until golden and crispy.
nutritional_facts.notes: These garlic Parmesan roasted potatoes are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

nutritional_facts.title: Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add cubed butternut squash and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until squash is tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in coconut milk, ground nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: This butternut squash soup is creamy and comforting, perfect for a cozy fall day.

nutritional_facts.title: Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: 1 cup roasted vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, zucchini, carrots)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa and roasted vegetables.
Add crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
nutritional_facts.notes: This quinoa salad with roasted vegetables is a hearty and flavorful dish, perfect for meal prep.

nutritional_facts.title: Mediterranean Chickpea Wraps
instructions: In a bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, olives, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Toss the chickpea mixture with the tahini dressing.
Spoon the mixture onto whole wheat wraps and roll up.
nutritional_facts.notes: These Mediterranean chickpea wraps are a fresh and satisfying lunch option.

nutritional_facts.title: Pumpkin Spice Energy Balls
instructions: In a bowl, combine rolled oats, almond butter, pumpkin puree, honey, mini chocolate chips, and pumpkin pie spice.
Mix until well combined.
Roll mixture into 1-inch balls and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
nutritional_facts.notes: These pumpkin spice energy balls are a delicious and nutritious snack, perfect for a quick pick-me-up.

nutritional_facts.title: Shrimp and Avocado Salad
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until pink and opaque.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, diced avocados, and red onion.
Add cooked shrimp on top.
Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: This shrimp and avocado salad is light and refreshing, perfect for a summer lunch.

nutritional_facts.title: Chili Lime Popcorn
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add popcorn kernels and cover with a lid.
Cook until popping slows down, then remove from heat.
In a bowl, combine chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, lime zest, and salt.
Toss popcorn with the spice mixture.
nutritional_facts.notes: This chili lime popcorn is a spicy and tangy snack, perfect for movie night.

nutritional_facts.title: Creamy Avocado Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a food processor, blend avocados, fresh basil, garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss pasta with the avocado sauce.
Serve garnished with cherry tomatoes.
nutritional_facts.notes: This creamy avocado pasta is a healthy and creamy alternative to traditional pasta sauces.

nutritional_facts.title: Roasted Red Pepper Hummus
instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, roasted red peppers, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
Blend until smooth.
With the processor running, slowly add olive oil until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper.
nutritional_facts.notes: This roasted red pepper hummus is a creamy and flavorful dip, perfect for vegetables or pita chips.

nutritional_facts.title: Maple Glazed Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together maple syrup, soy sauce, Dijon mustard, olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and brush with the maple glaze.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
nutritional_facts.notes: This maple glazed salmon is sweet and savory, perfect for a special dinner.

nutritional_facts.title: Crispy Chickpeas
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat chickpeas dry with a towel.
Toss chickpeas with olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until crispy.
nutritional_facts.notes: These crispy chickpeas are a crunchy and healthy snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Ginger Soy Glazed Tofu
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, pressed and cubed
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, maple syrup, rice vinegar, grated ginger, and minced garlic.
Heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add cubed tofu and cook until golden on all sides.
Add glaze and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until sauce has thickened.
nutritional_facts.notes: This ginger soy glazed tofu is flavorful and pairs well with rice or vegetables.

nutritional_facts.title: Avocado Toast with Cherry Tomatoes
instructions: Toast the bread slices.
Mash avocados and season with salt and pepper.
Spread mashed avocado on toasted bread.
Top with cherry tomatoes and drizzle with olive oil.
Garnish with fresh basil.
nutritional_facts.notes: This avocado toast with cherry tomatoes is a quick and delicious breakfast or snack.

nutritional_facts.title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Burritos
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss sweet potato cubes with olive oil, cumin, and chili powder.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
In a bowl, combine roasted sweet potatoes, black beans, cooked quinoa, and shredded cheddar cheese.
Spoon mixture onto whole wheat tortillas and roll up.
nutritional_facts.notes: These sweet potato and black bean burritos are hearty and nutritious, perfect for a satisfying meal.

nutritional_facts.title: Berry Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Granola and fresh berries for topping
instructions: In a blender, combine frozen mixed berries, banana, Greek yogurt, almond milk, and honey.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a bowl and top with granola and fresh berries.
nutritional_facts.notes: This berry smoothie bowl is a refreshing and healthy breakfast option.
